questions.question: Which sentence is a correct example of a mixed conditional?
options: If I win the lottery, I would have bought a house.
If I had won the lottery, I would buy a house now.
If I won the lottery, I will buy a house.
If I had won the lottery, I will buy a house.
questions.answer: If I had won the lottery, I would buy a house now.

questions.question: Complete the mixed conditional: 'If they had left earlier, they _____ stuck in traffic now.'
Identify the mixed conditional sentence:
options: If she practices every day, she will improve.
If she had listened to my advice, she wouldn't be in this mess now.
If she listened to my advice, she wouldn't be in this mess.
If she had listened to my advice, she wouldn't have been in this mess.
questions.answer: If she had listened to my advice, she wouldn't be in this mess now.
